An adsorbent material causes a substance, usually a gas, to form a very thin layer on its surface. : Fuller’s earth is a highly adsorbent claylike substance. Some specific gaseous pollutants may be removed by adsorbent beds.
More examplesFewer examplesGAC is a highly porous adsorbent material.These devices require frequent replacement of the adsorbent material.Once the adsorbent surface of the nose is filled with odorant molecules, it becomes saturated and no "stronger" smell will be perceived.

a material that causes a substance, usually a gas, to form a very thin layer on its surface: Several adsorbents are available, including silica gel and alumina. Animal charcoal is used as an adsorbent to remove colouring matter from food liquids.
More examplesFewer examplesSometimes, the adsorbate is incorporated into the structure of the adsorbent.Terra fullonica is used as an adsorbent in toiletries.When the adsorbent becomes saturated with odour molecules, its adsorptive capacity is greatly reduced.
